definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: The cracks and flaws in Mary's old performance have been skillfully varnished over.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽以往表演中的一些缺点都被巧妙地掩饰过去了。

sentences.english: As has been the case before, the military can be a trailblazer for the private sector.
sentences.chinese: 跟以往一样，美军可为私营企业开创道路。

sentences.english: He says this year the demand has been greater than ever.
sentences.chinese: 他说，今年的需求已经比以往任何时候都大。

sentences.english: Manchester United have won the top division title in England no less than 19 times.
sentences.chinese: 曼联在以往的英格兰顶级联赛中至少成功夺魁19次。

sentences.english: I am eating healthier than ever before.
sentences.chinese: 我现在比以往任何时候吃得都健康。

sentences.english: We have to be faster than ever with the ball.
sentences.chinese: 我们带球速度要比以往任何时候快。

sentences.english: As for the present, things are far better than at any time in the past.
sentences.chinese: 现在灵魂乐比以往任何时候都更加受欢迎。

sentences.english: He added that rice and maize genomes that were decoded in the past were much smaller.
sentences.chinese: 他补充道，以往解码的水稻与玉米基因组都要小的多。

sentences.english: The stars shone brighter than ever before, and an owl hooted in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 星星照耀得比以往更加明亮，猫头鹰在远处咕咕叫着。

sentences.english: It is just the presupposition as such that causes the failures of previous art defining.
sentences.chinese: 这个错误的假定，正是以往艺术定义活动失败的原因。

sentences.english: You will feel a need to bring things out into the open, more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 你会感到把事情带到台前的需要，超出以往任何时候。

sentences.english: One reason for such results is that inter-industry spillovers are neglected.
sentences.chinese: 对此，以往的研究常常忽略行业间溢出。

sentences.english: I rode in the women's car, as usual.
sentences.chinese: 跟以往一样，我坐在了“闺房车厢”。

sentences.english: The invention of telephones and telegrams made the world different.
sentences.chinese: 电话与电报的发明使世界不同以往。

sentences.english: People aroud the globe are more connected to each other than ever before.
sentences.chinese: 世界人民的联系比以往更加紧密。

sentences.english: The scandal he was involved in before detracts his from great glorious.
sentences.chinese: 他以往卷入的那件丑问已使他的光辉业绩大为失色。

definition: code of conduct/conventions/common practice/routine (medical procedure etc)
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
in fact/in reality/actually/as a matter of fact/de facto/ipso facto
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
not at all the same/substantially different
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
